alert.note: Alert for Sacramento Mountains Above 7500 Feet; Southern Gila Highlands, Black Range (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS El Paso (Southern New Mexico and extreme Western Texas)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 16 at 5:10AM MST until January 16 at 12:00PM MST by NWS El Paso
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON MST TODAY... * WHAT...Wet snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches below 7000 feet and 3 to 8 inches above 7000 feet in the Gila region. In the Sacramento Mountains, 3 to 5 inches are possible above 7500 feet. Blowing snow and winds diminishing late this evening. * WHERE...The Gila Region and Black Mountains above 7000 feet and the Sacramento Mountains above 7500 Feet. * WHEN...Until noon MST Monday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery and icy road conditions. Visibilities may occasionally drop below 1/4 mile due to falling and blowing snow. Travel could be difficult.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Sacramento Mountains Above 7500 Feet; Southern Gila Highlands, Black Range
